column4: I am trying to use my iphone as a webcam and mic for Skype on my Ubuntu 10.04 machine. Using the iPhone app for Skype is limited, and can only see my own video, and not the caller's, plus if I want to look at the camera, I am unable to look at the screen. I have iWebcamera installed on my iPhone.
(sorry for repeat, was on wrong nickname)
This isn't really an ubuntu issue. If someone HAPPENS to be using that sort of setup they MAY be able to help... but this seems to be more an issue with the applications you are using.
It isn't. Wireless, however, is inherently complicated. Try it in dos.
It was a bit of a joke. https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/WiFiHowTo
when I do thr it keeps sayibg invalid argument
you can just put the 1004 dvd in and use the partitioner there for install.
That is how it is done. Stop typing line after line. Your phone is not hitting enter, you are.
I think you might need to reinstall your wireless driver. Can't you plug in an ethernet cable to try and get this taken care of?
I would expect grub-install; update-grub would just do what you want with both OSes installed, but am not positive.
Can you please explain the original problem to me again? I just dropped in
also what version of ubuntu you are on
no... you need the intel GPU accelleration package.
what does top reveal about what is chewing up your cpu/memory?
